hr.fer.oop.lab4.pic

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.oop.lab4.pic.Picture

  • public class Picture
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Picture represents a black-and-white picture. It provides methods for turning pixels on and off as well as to render a picture on terminal console. Here is an usage example which creates an empty image 200x100 pixels, draws single horizontal line and renders image on standard output. 
       // Create picture:
   Picture pic = new Picture(200, 100);
   
   // Draw horizontal line on y=10:
   for(int i = 0, n = pic.getWidth(); i < n; i++) {
     pic.turnPixelOn(i, 10);
   }
   
   // Render picture in ASCII-graphics on standard output:
   pic.renderImageToStream(System.out);
    Author:
    marcupic

    • Constructor Detail

      • Picture

        public Picture(int width,
               int height)
        Picture constructor which constructs an empty picture. In this picture all pixels are initially turned off.
        Parameters:
        width - width of picture; must be greater or equals to 1.
        height - height of picture; must be greater or equals to 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is smaller than 1

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns width of this picture.
        Returns:
        width

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns height of this picture.
        Returns:
        height

      • getBim

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBim()
        Returns live representation of this picture as BufferedImage object. This object can be then used for picture visualization in standard GUI Swing components. The term "live" means that any change performed in this object will be visible in this picture as well.
        Returns:
        live representation of current picture

      • turnPixelOn

        public void turnPixelOn(int x,
                        int y)
        Method turns on pixel on position (x,y). Coordinates start with 0 and increment from upper left picture corner to right and toward bottom. Maximal legal x is width-1 and maximal legal y is height-1.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of pixel
        y - y-coordinate of pixel
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x or y is either negative or bigger than maximal legal value

      • turnPixelOff

        public void turnPixelOff(int x,
                         int y)
        Method turns off pixel on position (x,y). Coordinates start with 0 and increment from upper left picture corner to right and toward bottom. Maximal legal x is width-1 and maximal legal y is height-1.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of pixel
        y - y-coordinate of pixel
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x or y is either negative or bigger than maximal legal value

      • renderImageToStream

        public void renderImageToStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Method renders current picture on given output stream using ASCII-art. For each pixel which is turned off, '.' is emitted and for each pixel which is turned on '*' is emitted. For example, to render picture pic on programs standard output use: 
           pic.renderImageToStream(System.out);
        Parameters:
        out - output stream on which picture should be rendered.
